# ðŸ›¸ UFO Invasions: Commit Message Template

# Format: GPZ-XX: <type>(<scope>): <description>
#
# Example commits:
# GPZ-82: feat(backend): implement MongoDB connection and JWT auth
# GPZ-83: deploy(contract): add UFOInvasionsNFT to BSC testnet  
# GPZ-84: feat(missions): implement pump detection algorithm
# GPZ-81: ci(sync): add GitHub Actions for platform integration
#
# Types:
# feat     - new feature implementation
# fix      - bug fix
# docs     - documentation updates
# style    - formatting, missing semicolons, etc
# refactor - code change that neither fixes bug nor adds feature
# perf     - performance improvement
# test     - adding missing tests
# chore    - updating dependencies, build tasks
# ci       - CI/CD pipeline changes
# deploy   - deployment related changes
#
# Scopes:
# backend  - server-side logic, APIs, database
# frontend - React components, UI, UX
# contract - smart contracts, blockchain
# sync     - platform integration, workflows
# docs     - documentation, README updates
# test     - testing infrastructure, specs
# devops   - CI/CD, deployment, infrastructure
#
# Rules:
# - Start with GPZ-XX where XX is the Linear issue number
# - Use imperative mood ("add" not "added")
# - Keep first line under 50 characters
# - Reference GitHub issues with "Closes #XX" if applicable
# - Add detailed explanation in body if needed
#
# This template enables automatic synchronization between
# GitHub commits, Linear issues, and Notion task tracking.
